alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Warren County in New Jersey. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 210 PM EDT, minor flooding was occurring along Beaver Brook in the Belvidere area, and along some other small streams and creeks. The flooding is due to runoff from Sunday`s heavy rainfall. - The waterways should return within their banks this evening. - For Beaver Brook at Belvidere: At 2:00 pm the brook level was 4.61 feet and falling. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
